Entries.PoetryClub_PC1: A fine example of narrative poetry. Romantic, yet tragic.$2
Entries.PoetryClub_PC2: The writing is so evocative, I can almost feel the sun on my face, the heat against my skin.$1
Entries.PoetryClub_PC3: Such bleak imagery, and so forboding! Oh, it fair sends a shiver down my spine.$2

Entries.CCrain.000: Ugh, I can't believe I'm getting up early on a day like today to talk about poetry.$2
Entries.PoetryClub_PC1: It's so depressing. I wish there was a way they could've been together. But that's poetry isn't it? Romantic misery.$2
Entries.PoetryClub_PC2: I'm pretty sure the poet's in love with him. Hey @, what sort of day would you compare me to?$1
Entries.PoetryClub_PC3: Ravens? They're nasty birds. This one's too creepy for me. I bet Sebastian would loves it.$2

Entries.PoetryClub_PC1: I can't say I'm a fan of the whole 'sacrifice your life for a man's' narrative. Especially when he died anyway.$2
Entries.PoetryClub_PC2: I hope you're not pretending this poem's about you, Elliott!$1
Entries.PoetryClub_PC3: It's a bit dark and melancholic. The narrator's grief really resonates in the words.$2

Entries.PoetryClub_PC1: 'The moon was a ghostly galleon tossed upon cloudy seas'. Oh, how Noyes’ evocative words make me think of stormy nights on the Gem Sea.$8
Entries.PoetryClub_PC2: I often wonder who Shakespeare could have been speaking of…$4
Entries.PoetryClub_PC3: Poe’s poem always sends cold shivers down my spine. What might the significance of the raven be?

Because I read your recommended readings... and some of them were outright scandalous!$3"/move farmer 5 0 2 true/pause 500/emote Elliott 60/speak Elliott "The difference, perhaps, is in the subtlety. The metaphor and turn of phrase. This? This is just crass!"/speak Haley "Hmm, I never took you for a literary snob, Elliott. Or a prude."/faceDirection Haley 0/speak Haley "Anyway, @'s here. Hey, @, what do you think?#$b#Should popular music count as poetry?"/quickQuestion #Yes, of course!#No way.#Keep me out of this.#It's subjective.(break)emote Haley 20\speak Haley "Hah, see?"(break)emote Haley 12\speak Elliott "Ah, I see @, you have refined tastes too."(break)speak Haley "Spoilsport."(break)speak Elliott "Of course, yes, spoken like a true neutralist.#$b#Poetry, like art, is indeed subjective."/pause 500/speak Leah "Can you two just agree to disagree on this one?#$b#Now, are we going to hear the poem for today, or not?"/speak Elliott "I am prepared to agree on a compromise, Haley."/faceDirection Haley 2/speak Elliott "For poetry should, at its base level, evoke emotion, and if your popular music affects you at that level, then so be it.$1"/emote Haley 60/pause 1000/speak Haley "Err, thanks. I think."/speak Elliott "Now if you would care to begin the reading for today..."/pause 1000/speak Haley "You mean I have to read this... out loud?!$8"/emote Haley 28/pause 1000/end
